initial_question.title: Deleted sysadmin user by mistake
initial_question.body:
**Component**

<!-- Choose one of the following and delete all others. -->
 * Generic

**Description**
It is a super silly question, but, my coworker removed the sysadmin user by mistake from the Thingsboard database. How can I create it again?

**Environment**
<!-- Add information about your environment and ThingsBoard version if applicable -->
 * OS:  Ubuntu 22.04
 * ThingsBoard: 3.8

satisfaction_conditions: A user account must have SYS_ADMIN authority level in the system
The user must have correct database associations (tenant_id and customer_id)
The changes must be persistent in the ThingsBoard database

initial_question.title: View entities in descending order in "Update Multiple Attributes" widget
initial_question.body:
**Component**

 * UI

**Description**
By default, the "Update Multiple Attributes" widget will display entities in an ascending order. If I have an alias that contains three devices named Employee 1, Employee 2, and Employee 3, then the widget will display Employee 3 at the top and Employee 1 at the bottom. I would like to display entities in a descending order instead, such that Employee 1 is at the top and Employee 3 is at the bottom, is there a way to do this?

**Environment**
 * ThingsBoard: 3.7.0

satisfaction_conditions: Entities must display in descending order based on their numeric identifiers
The ordering must be maintained consistently in the Update Multiple Attributes widget
The ordering solution must work within ThingsBoard version 3.7.0

initial_question.title: How to store our data at widgetContext to use it globally as variable?
initial_question.body:
**Cant we store some of our data at widgetContext to use it globally**

If possible, so please let me know how and where.
Thank you.

satisfaction_conditions: Data must persist across different widget instances
Data must be accessible from any widget in the application
Data must be modifiable and retrievable at runtime
Storage mechanism must work with both custom and provided widgets

initial_question.title: How to extract device-gateway data in rulechain?
initial_question.body:
**Component**
 * Rule Engine

**Question**
How can I get information about GATEWAY originator in rulechain.

**Description**
I have device that serves as Gateway. It uses MQTT, topic v1/gateway/telemetry to send messages about sensors like:

`{
"dev_11":
[{
"Temperature":23.9,
"RSSI":-105,
"Battery":153
}]
}`

Works great - it posts telemetry to rulechain with originator "dev_11" but I'd like to save name of the Gateway device that initiated the message. 


**Environment** 
 * ThingsBoard: version 3.6.4 CE

satisfaction_conditions: The retrieved gateway information must be accessible within the rule chain processing flow
The solution must work with the gateway telemetry format using v1/gateway/telemetry MQTT topic

initial_question.title: [Question] Saving Attribute From Custom Widget
initial_question.body:
I'm trying to save a value as an attribute.
I'm using
```
attributeService = self.ctx.$scope.$injector.get('attributeService');
attributeService.saveEntityAttributes(entityId,attributeScope,attributes);
```
I get this error
```
Uncaught NullInjectorError: R3InjectorError(class extends o{})[attributeService -> attributeService -> attributeService -> attributeService]:

```
What is the solution for this?

satisfaction_conditions: Attribute service must be correctly injected without throwing NullInjectorError
Entity ID must be provided in the correct format

initial_question.title: [Question] How to specify sortOrder from custom widget
initial_question.body:
**Component**

 * UI

**Description**
I try to specify a sortOrder into a pageLink to get my results sorted (in this case devices sorted by name).

**Environment**
 * OS:  name and version
 * ThingsBoard: 3.1 PE
 * Browser: Firefox

When developing custom widget you can request devices assigned to a certain customer using this call:
`self.ctx.deviceService.getCustomerDevices(customerId, pageLink).subscribe(....`

This works fine with default pageLink that you obtain like this:

`self.ctx.pageLink()`; 

or even like this 

`self.ctx.pageLink(200, 0, '', null);  `

where 200 is the max page size, 0 is the current page, '' is the search string and I guess last parameter is the sortOrder.

Now I don't know how to specify sortOrder. The closest I got was with this:
```
       var pl = self.ctx.pageLink(200, 0, '', null);
       pl['sortOrder'] = {};
       pl.sortOrder['direction'] = 'ASC';
       pl.sortOrder['key'] = {};
       pl.sortOrder.key['key'] = 'name';
       pl.sortOrder.key['type'] = 'ENTITY_FIELD';
```

which succeed to inject sortOrder in the request but not the sortProperty.

/devices?pageSize=200&page=0&sortProperty=undefined&sortOrder=ASC&type=

Logically resulting in a 500 server error with that error:

`org.hibernate.QueryException: could not resolve property: undefined of: org.thingsboard.server.dao.model.sql.DeviceEntity [SELECT d FROM org.thingsboard.server.dao.model.sql.DeviceEntity d WHERE d.tenantId = :tenantId AND d.customerId = :customerId AND LOWER(d.searchText) LIKE LOWER(CONCAT(:searchText, '%')) order by d.undefined asc]; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: org.hibernate.QueryException: could not resolve property: undefined of: org.thingsboard.server.dao.model.sql.DeviceEntity [SELECT d FROM org.thingsboard.server.dao.model.sql.DeviceEntity d WHERE d.tenantId = :tenantId AND d.customerId = :customerId AND LOWER(d.searchText) LIKE LOWER(CONCAT(:searchText, '%')) order by d.undefined asc]`

So what is the proper way of performing this request with sort order on a field?

satisfaction_conditions: The request must successfully retrieve customer devices

initial_question.title: [Question] How can thingsboard gateway connect multiple OPC servers?
initial_question.body:
The usage scenario is as follows: each device has an independent OPC server. Now I can correctly collect the device through the thingsboard gateway, but opcua In the configuration of JSON, the address of an OPC server corresponding to each device cannot be configured.
In the seemingly TB configuration, the "opc-ua" scenario only supports one server corresponding to multiple devices.
How can I configure the gateway to support one configuration and access all devices?

I need to configure an array "server"？
or
I need to configure multiple "opcua. json"

satisfaction_conditions: Gateway must be able to connect to multiple distinct OPC servers simultaneously
Each OPC server connection must be independently configurable
Gateway configuration must maintain unique identification for each OPC server connection
Solution must work within Thingsboard gateway's existing configuration system

initial_question.title: [Question] how to setup a staging environment in clustered mode - licence key conflict
initial_question.body:
**Component**
 * Installation

**Description**
I'm trying to setup a staging environment in my company to test changes for my tenants before applying them on the production environment.
Both environments are running TB PE 3.3.1 with hybrid storage (postgres+cassandra).
I want the staging environment to be a copy of the production environment data-wise, so I purchased another TB licence to run the staging environment, then tried to dump & restore the postgres database from the production instance on the staging instance.
However the production database somehow contains the licence information embedded in it.
Now my staging environment does not start and I have no idea how to reapply my 2nd license key while keeping the rest of the data.

How should I proceed ?

**Environment**
 * OS:  ubuntu
 * ThingsBoard: 3.3.1PE running on docker-compose

satisfaction_conditions: The staging environment must successfully start with its own valid license
Production data must be successfully transferred to staging without license conflicts
Each environment (production and staging) must maintain its distinct license identity

initial_question.title: Device Profile Alarm Rule - alarm severity cannot be change from Critical to Major
initial_question.body:
Consider the following device profile alarm rule:
creation condition 1: if device temperature > 4, create High Temperature alarm with Critical severity
creation condition 2: if device temperature > 0 and temperature <=4, create High Temperature alarm with Major severity
clear condition: if device temperature < 0

Test result:
1. device temperature = 2, new alarm with Major severity is created => OK
2. device temperature = 5, alarm is updated with Critical Severity => OK
3. device temperature = 2 again, no update to alarm severity => NOT OK
4. device temperature = -1, alarm is cleared => OK

Question: in step 3,  should the alarm be updated with severity set to Major?

satisfaction_conditions: Alarm severity must maintain the highest recorded severity level until cleared
Alarm creation and clearing must follow the defined temperature thresholds
Multiple alarm conditions for the same alarm type must update the existing alarm rather than create new ones

Regards
Ged

satisfaction_conditions: Menu items must conditionally display based on server attribute values
Solution must work within HTML/Markdown card widget context

initial_question.title: how to use ctx attribute service to call getEntityTimeseries
initial_question.body:
**Component**

<!-- Choose one of the following and delete all others. -->
 * Generic

**Description**
 Hi,
I want to call ctx.attributeservice.getEntityTimeseries  to get sum of timseries as a column in EntityTable-widget. so I called that in 
advanced javascript section of widget column.


**_e = entity.id; //entityId
t = ["lat"]; //keys keys=gas,temperature
n = 1479735870785; //startTs
i = 1479735871858; //endTs
a = 100; //limit
o = "SUM" //agg
u = 60000; //interval
p = "AVG"; //orderBy
d = false; //useStrictDataTypes
m = 1; //config

sum= ctxmain.attributeService.getEntityTimeseries(
    entityId = e, keys = t, startTs = n, endTs = i,
    agg = o, interval = u , limit=a);        
return sum;_**

 but i am witnessed this result:

**_e {_isScalar: false, source: e, operator: e}
operator: e {project: ƒ, thisArg: undefined}
source: e {_isScalar: false, source: e, operator: e}
_isScalar: false
__proto__: Object_**

i expect to get a number or list of number as output, please give me a solution
thanks in advance

**Environment**
<!-- Add information about your environment and ThingsBoard version if applicable -->

 * ThingsBoard: CE

satisfaction_conditions: The function must handle asynchronous data retrieval
The returned data must be properly parsed to access timeseries values
The service must be correctly accessed through the ThingsBoard context
The function must return numerical values or arrays of numerical values
The query parameters (entityId, keys, timestamps, etc.) must be properly passed to the service call

initial_question.title: REST API call 'getCustomerDevices' has changed
initial_question.body:
**Component**

<!-- Choose one of the following and delete all others. -->
 * Installation
 * REST API

**Description**
REST API call 'getCustomerDevices' has changed after updating TB from **v2.4.3** to **v.3.2.2**
In v2.4.3. it was:
_get /api/customer/{customerId}/devices{?type,textSearch,idOffset,textOffset,limit}_

In v3.2.2 it is
_get /api/customer/{customerId}/devices{?type,textSearch,sortProperty,sortOrder,pageSize,page}_ 

The problem is that with v2.4.3 API I was able to get a list of all devices that are assigned to the customer. With v.3.2.2 I have to iterate through the pages to get a complete list of assigned devices. 

We use our own developped MES to show devices that are assigned to specific customers which is not possible anymore. 
Is there a way to use the old REST API version from v2.4.3 with the new v3.2.2?

**Environment**
<!-- Add information about your environment and ThingsBoard version if applicable -->
 * OS:  Kybernetes installation
 * ThingsBoard: 3.2.2
 * Browser: Firefox

satisfaction_conditions: API request must return complete device list for a customer in a single response
Solution must work with ThingsBoard v3.2.2

Dashboard states

 * UI
Multiple dashboard for devices

Is there a way to hide a widget based on the device type that's clicked?  For Example I have an entity list widget with all my devices on my first landing page dashboard.  The user clicks on the device and it goes to a dashboard state with detailed info.  I have devices that are very similar but may or may not have an extra feature such as humidity.  So basically if I have a device with temperature and humidity I want to show the graphs of temperature and humidity when I click on that type of device.  If I have a device with only temperature the info dashboard should have no humidity graph.  

Is the only way to do this with multiple dashboards?  The issue I have with that is there are several other widgets on the info page and if I make a change to one of those other widgets I now have to duplicate the change on the other dashboards....

 * ThingsBoard: 2.3.4
 * Browser: Chrome (latest version)

Device-specific data must be correctly filtered

initial_question.title: [Question] DomSanitzer in Widget for base64 encoded data
initial_question.body:
**Component**

<!-- Choose one of the following and delete all others. -->
 * UI
 * Widget
 
**Description**
My IoT application acquires audio signals from deployed devices. The short audio clips (<500KB) are base64 encoded and sent to TB as a JSON key/value. My goal is to provide access to the latest recordings on the dashboard so the user can quickly evaluate and take necessary action.

So I created a new widget to display the html5 audio element and set its src to the base64 encoded data string like this:`src="data:audio/wav;base64,UklGRgh3AQBXQVZFZm10IBAAAAAB … /6//q/+T/3P/g/9v/4//a/+j/3f/o/+X/6P/t//D/9v/3/w=="`. However, Angular does not permit this because it is considered an unsafe url and disables it by prepending `unsafe` to the string like this: `src="unsafe:data:audio/wav;base64,UklGRgh3AQBXQVZFZm10IBAAAAAB … /6//q/+T/3P/g/9v/4//a/+j/3f/o/+X/6P/t//D/9v/3/w=="`.

The obvious solution is to use Angular's DomSanitizer (`domSanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustUrl()`) but it is not accessible within the widget's scope and it cannot be imported at runtime. A search of this repo shows numerous usages of the DomSanitizer, including in various widget components (ui-ngx/src/app/modules/home/components/widget/lib/alarms-table-widget.component.ts, ui-ngx/src/app/modules/home/components/widget/lib/entities-table-widget.component.ts, ui-ngx/src/app/modules/home/components/widget/lib/timeseries-table-widget.component.ts, etc.). 

Is it possible to access the DomSanitizer in a Widget? If so, how? If not, what other options can I try?

**Environment**
<!-- Add information about your environment and ThingsBoard version if applicable -->
 * OS:  AWS EC2 
 * ThingsBoard: PE 3.0.1
 * Browser: Chrome 84

satisfaction_conditions: URL sanitization bypass must be available within widget scope

satisfaction_conditions: Device name must be successfully retrieved from the device service response
Dashboard state transition must occur with both entityId and entityName parameters

Device service injection must be successful within the widget context

initial_question.title: [Question] How to exploit JSON Support in Widgets and Dashboards [2.5.2]
initial_question.body:
The latest 2.5+ versions of TB support JSON in Telemetries & Attributes.
However, there seems to be no added feature to access these datasets in the widgets Datasource section.

I've tried dot notation with no luck, and I've also tried to use the Post-processing function to return sub-values of the JSON data, but the editor keeps demanding that the function must return a value.

Sample functions:

    return value.key1; //Fails to compile
    return value["key1"]; //Fails
    return JSON.parse(value).key1; //Also fails

How can we access inner fields in a JSON on the dashboards?

satisfaction_conditions: Successfully extracts nested values from JSON data in widget datasources
Returns a valid value that the widget can process
Handles potential undefined/missing JSON fields gracefully
Works within ThingsBoard's widget datasource configuration system
